result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne J Bigelow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay Court costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
---------------------------------------

Commencing FORTHWITH With Huber.  IT IS HEREBY Ordered that the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward all restitution and outstanding fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence. 

OR 

If Defendant chooses to serve sentences WITHOUT Huber the sentence time will be reduced by one third. 


Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.
---------------------------------------
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
---------------------------------------

See Count #1. 
---------------------------------------
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Count 1 and to any other sentence. 
---------------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wayne J Bigelow

records.addlTxt:
11:39 AM Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared in court for Wayne J Bigelow, Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Wayne J Bigelow appeared in court, in custody. 
Attorney Berg advises Court of agreement that has been reached.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 2.  As part of agreement, count 3 is to be dismissed and read-in.
Court has a colloquy with defendant.
Deportation warning given.
Attorney Uzowulu believes plea to be made freely, knowingly and voluntarily.
State is in compliance with victims' right.
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty of count 1 and 2.  Count 3 is dismissed and read-in. 
Court will adopt agreement and impose:

Two (2) months Jail on count 1 WITH Huber, consecutive to any other sentence commencing forthwith.
Seven (7) months Jail on count 2 WITH Huber, consecutive to count 1 and any other sentence.

OR, if defendant chooses to serve sentences WITHOUT Huber the sentence time will be reduced by one third.

Sixty- four (64) days dead time credit, if confirmed by Jail records.

Costs only on both counts.
DNA sample and surcharge.

Defendant Wayne J Bigelow in court, in custody by video with attorney Obi Uzowulu.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant given offer and submitted counter-offer. Free to argue.   Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Wayne J Bigelow in court, in custody by video with attorney Obi Uzowulu.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made.  Reading of complaint waived.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Wayne J Bigelow appeared in Court, in custody by video. Vivian TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint not signed. Minutes filed.

Defendant Wayne J Bigelow appeared in Court, in custody by video. Vivian TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant referred to SPD. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH J.A.B. OR K.W. OR RESIDENCES.  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
